author: Lukas I. Alpert
title: News Corp Revenue Boosted by Digital Real Estate Unit
text:
News Corp reported a 3% rise in revenue for the December quarter, led by continued growth in its digital real-estate unit, while weakness in the advertising business weighed on the news and information-services segment.
For the quarter, the company reported a net loss of $84 million, or 14 cents a share, compared with a loss of $290 million, or 50 cents a share, in the same period a year earlier, when results were affected by a significant impairment charge and asset write-down.
